result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Charles Matzen

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court for Nicholas Charles Matzen.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Arraignment held.
Original Information received and filed.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and defense counsel entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
Defense counsel requests adjournment of approximately 45 days to review discovery.
Court grants request and orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28. 

Clerk:  jms
Order to Produce signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court for Nicholas Charles Matzen.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective V. Lopez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. State requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.
Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen not in court, in custody in Greenbay.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court in person for Nicholas Charles Matzen.  Prosecuting attorney Ian Vance-Curzan in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant unable to be produced by Greenbay. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.  (Nicholas C. Matzen - #509256, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with any family member of E.R.
Defendant to have no contact with any witness mentioned in the criminal complaint:  M.M.,  and/or  M.A.E.,  and/or  A.T.,   and/or  F.T.

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen (appears via Zoom video), in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Also present in court, Atty. Frederick Klimetz, appearing as a friend of the court (appears in person).

Due to the State Public Defender failing to timely appoint counsel the court appointed counsel at Milwaukee County expense.
The Court appoints Attorney Frederick Klimetz to represent defendant at the rate of $125 per hour;  Attorney Klimetz present in court and accepted the appointment. 
Court did not rule on today's date whether defendant to repay the County.

Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Order Appointing Counsel to be forwarded to the Court for Judge's signature.

State requests No Contact Order be signed.

Clerk:  jms
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case is adjourned for order to show cause hearing in Branch 28.

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Nicholas Charles Matzen in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas Charles Matzen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
